Reviews.Title: “convenient, good price, not the quietest”
Reviews.Author: Laura Y
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Emperor Hotel this past weekend and overall it was a pleasant experience. Only bad thing was that I was given a room right next to the elevator so it was pretty noisy. However, I was very happy with my room - it wasn't as outdated as I had expected - there was an ipod speaker/charger on my nightstand, and the wifi connection was great. The room felt surprisingly spacious and I was a fan of the bed (as mentioned in previous reviews, the mattresses are hard). Also had dim sum at Golden Valley (the one-star Michelin restaurant on the first floor) and it was very good although a bit on the pricey side. As for the location of the hotel, it's very ideal. The Emperor Hotel offers a free shuttle bus every hour or so that takes you to some of the key places on the island (times square, lee gardens, IFC, etc.) You can also walk a couple blocks down and catch the tram that runs on the main road for 2.30HKD. Additionally, there's a public shuttle bus that stops right next to the hotel that can take you to Causeway/Times Square. That runs more frequently than the hotel shuttle. All in all, if you can put up with a little noise and a hard mattress, this is a great place to stay. Good quality and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: acjkt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a last minute deal on Agoda, the rate was very favourable - at first, I wasn't sure about the location but it turned out to be perfectly fine. Communication with the hotel by email prior to arrival was answered promptly and efficiently and all requests I made were attended to. We arrived very early in the morning from an overnight flight and were able to store our bags while we went off for the day. On return, the receptionist was very polite and handled everything efficiently. We were upgraded to an Executive room which was a welcome suprise. The room was very clean, spacious and had everything we neededed. There was not much of a view other than other apartment blocks, some of which were so close you could actually see people cooking, however we were there only really to sleep anyway. The beds were the hard Chinese variety but that seems to pretty much the norm in hotels in Hong Kong that are not Western Chain owned. There was free internet which worked very well. Breakfast was included in our rate and whilst the restaurant was very small, the selection was good and the staff pleasant and efficient. Location wise, it is in a mainly residential area, close to the racecourse, there is a 24 hour Mcdonalds which is walkable, and a supermarket and other shops close by. There is a tram to North Point, Causeway Bay and most of Hong Kong Island just five minutes away, otherwise taxis are plentiful and we never had to wait more than a few minutes to find one. Just make sure you keep the hotel key card with you to show the taxi driver as not all of them speak English and it can be challenging to get them to understand where you want to go. There is a free hotel shuttle bus which takes you to Times Square Mall in Causeway Bay, we found this very useful. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and certainly would happily stay here again because of the staff professionalism and the cleanliness which are something I value highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good pick for business trip”
Reviews.Author: JackHoShanghai_China
Reviews.Content: It just cost me less than USD 80 per night, which is quite price-competitive. You can catch the public mini-bus to go to Causeway Bay. A few bars and restaurants and 24-hr McDonald's nearby. Quiet and it's around 5-min walking distance to get to Happy Valley Racecourse. Good for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location but close too transit. A touch dated and spartan rooms.”
Reviews.Author: croz17
Reviews.Content: Family recommend I stay here. Booked on agoda and paid about $115 a night. In a quiet area away from the bustle. Courteous and helpful staff and very clean. Great free wifi. Bed was from an army barracks - hard as a rock. Having said that, I slept great every night. Breakfast can be had for 70HKD if you buy tickets at check in otherwise it is 110HKD. It is so so with a marginal selection but quality is ok and the convenience gets you out the door early to explore. Lots of good local food in the area, laundry, mcDonalds if you need a fix. #30 minibus gets you to cause way bay MTR in 5 minutes and you will beved wait more than 5 minutes at the bus stop across the street. Walk to the race track. Paid the same to stay at the butterfly boutique hotel on Morrison rd. butterfly is way more modern, chic and cool and closer to causeway bay. I would still recommend the emperor if you don't mind spartan rooms in a quiet locale. Don't kid yourself it is a western 3 star equivalent and not a 4 star like many sites say. Most hotels in HK in the same price range are 3 stars but that meets my needs!

Reviews.Title: “should not be anyone's first choice.”
Reviews.Author: kovalex
Reviews.Content: I opted for the Emperor as I had an early meeting nearby. I am a Hong Kong resident. I chose to stay with my wife and 3month old. A '+' is that they were able to provide a cot for baby. If impersonal service doesn't bother you - you should be fine. Check in staff went through the motions, but didn't make me or my wife feel welcomed. If you like the taste of nicotine - get your kicks in the reception as well as our room - which reeked of cigarette. We got over it but it wasn't pleasant. If repeated fire alarm bells at 10PM, 1130PM and first thing in the morning don't bother you, this hotel should be fine. This was our first stay outside of our home with baby. The sound of the fire alarm on the 20th floor late at night scared the [--] out of me imagining it were a real fire. Forget about any mention of apologies for the inconvenience at checkout. These were absent. if you like room ventilation/temperature options of on or off, then this room should be fine. When my wife called the reception to ask for a late checkout, the voice on the other side was not pleasant nor accommodating. What i didn't do was visit the Chinese Michelin-rated restaurant. I've heard good reviews from friends. Perhaps it would have left me feeling there was something good at the Emperor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but one very bad experience with one rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Charity K
Reviews.Content: We were here last January 23-27, 2012. We haven't had a lot of time to stay and evaluate the hotel basically because we were all around hong kong during the days and too tired to do anything in the hotel when we get back but sleep. So here goes my review: PROS. 1. Staff were very helpful, initially we had problem with our payment because our credit card was expired and we can only withdraw a certain maximum amount of HKD per day on the ATM. ( I think it was only 3,000+ HKD/day and we need cash to shop, eat and do sight seeing!) and there's no bank open cos it was the holidays! They agreed that we will pay on a per day basis until banks were open. 2. Location is very accessible, however if you were to ride a taxi and you don't speak chinese, make sure to bring with you the hotel's calling card and they will know exactly where to drop you ( you can get this upon arrival in the airport at the hotel assistance desk). near to mini bus stop #30C which will only take you to about 5-10 minutes to causebay station/times square. 3. Room and CR was clean and average in size. 4. They have a FREE shuttle bus service. however, it is with schedule so we chose to ride the mini bus for the experience and also convenience of our own time. CONS. 1. We arrived about 3am on our 3rd night because we went to Macau, and the front desk was being rude when we ask him about our bill and all that. (maybe because we woke him up at 3am! but it is his job.) He was the only rude and male staff in the front desk.. That was the only con thing I have to say. But it was a seriously bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: atina2090
Reviews.Content: A great hotel away from the busy crowds of Causeway Bay & Wan Chai, yet conveniently located within walking distance to both locations. This is an older style hotel which represents great value for money, is close to tram stop, buses, shops and restaurants in Happy Valley. Rooms are small yet comfortable and for a fee wifi is available. If I am looking for peace & quiet, I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, various breakfast,Good Location Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: masrura
Reviews.Content: I was stay in this Hotel during my exhibition trip in Hongkong. The Hotel was Nice, the room is small as other Hongkong Hotel but Nice specially the Bathroom superb. The room and bathroom was clean. I have really enjoy the breakfast. Normally when we stay in 3 or 4 star hotel in Hongkong mostly they provide Asian dishes but this hotel provide european breakfast most. Kind of bread like croissant, muffins, you may also make your own wafel fresh. Egg corner where you can choice. Even the restaurant is small and crowded when the breakfast time. Location was my reason to stay. Only 5 minute walk to can find a tram that will bring you direct to causeway bay. A centre where many shops, restaurant you can found. Its only 10 minutes by tram.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Small Hotel Away From City Buzz”
Reviews.Author: Bridgehouse_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this small, friendly hotel four or five times per year for nearly ten years. Happy Valley is a quiet district away from the city buzz with several local restaurauts, bars and shops. The rooms are small but are big enough for four night stays, have good beds, showers and are always clean. The coffee shop serves excellent breakfast. The front desk and coffee shop staff are always friendly and helpful. The only downside is the wait for taxis in the morning rush hour if you forget to pre-book.

Reviews.Title: “HAPPY VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeViews
Reviews.Content: Old world charm, classical ambiance, traditional service from the heart! This hotel offers all these ... and more. My adult daughter & I (a retiree) absolutely relished the cozy, sizeable room and the understated but truly fantastic service. Our travel adaptor could not fit. We needed to charge our cellphone batteries. On the way to reception, I bumped into a staff in the lift. He asked if he could help. When told he immediately fished out an adaptor from his pocket and handed it to me I asked if I should return it to reception at the end of my stay. I asked if he needed my room number. He flashed a huge smile and told me (in Cantonese) to just leave it in the room. How tremendously seamless and hassle-free. Wow! I asked for directions for the different destinations. The reception staff took pains to show me the way with map and all. I asked how to get to a particular Michelin star restaurant. Unfazed, they photocopied a map which was shown on a newpaper write-up on the outlet. This is all the more amazing as they have their own Michelin star restaurant (Golden Valley - must try the titilating experience) on the 2nd floor of the hotel! Yahoo! Their shuttle-bus service is a God-send.The complimentary service runs in the morning and evening. It is off-service in the afternoon which is wise as traffic can be a chokefull. It covers Central, Wanchai, Causeway Bay, IFC, HK Convention & Exhibition Centre, Times Square, Lee Gardens. We planned our outing making us of this service. Yipee! They gave us a Walkabout Map upon check-in. The streets around the hotel and somewhat tired and humble looking. But there are supermarkets, 24-hr stores, post office, Starbucks, McDonald's, Tram Terminus & the Happy Valley Race Course within walking distance. Overall.... unbelievably Happy Value!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Good service. Small but elegant rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Charron
Reviews.Content: The room and beds are small, but elegant. The bathroom is relatively spacial in HK. The location is quite convenient, which is located on the hill near Hong Kong Sanatorium & Hospital. It is a quiet and peaceful area. If you carry your luggage by yourself, it is hard to walk because of the slopes. The final tram stop "Happy Valley" is near the hotel. No.30 mini bus is going bypass the door. There are Parkn Shop, Marketplace and Watson's near there. A lot of famous and delicious restaurants are for you to choose as well. The service is good. The hotel offers free shuttle bus between different main shopping malls from Central, Wan Chai to Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: mishous
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the room I had was great although I was given a room with a single bed (I would have preferred a queen/king). The hotel has a shuttle bus but it only runs until midday which was inconvenient as I had to taxi all the time. Taxi's are cheap however they add up when you have to use them a few times a day, it becomes expensive especially when I was also using the MTR. Other hotels in the area run their shuttle buses until 8pm. This hotel did not have a free breakfast either and I could not find a restaurant nearby so again had to taxi into Times Square to eat. Yet another Taxi ride. The other thing I found was because this hotel was a little far out from things, Taxi's did not pass by that often which when I had to leave for the Airport at 6:30am made me start to question whether I'd make my flight. Not sure if I'd stay again. If the price was good I would, however I am returning to Hong Kong and have choosen to stay in a hotel right in the heart of Wan Chai for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast for one?”
Reviews.Author: MaxCat888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location with friendly staff. Everything was good EXCEPT that there were 2 guests in the room, but they only provided 1 breakfast ticket per day, which did not make any sense to us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Prices are creeping up”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan N
Reviews.Content: Still good but in my 6 day stay I paid 3 different prices according volume of trade. I did think that as a guest now of 3 times they might have given me a slightly better deal as they have building work going on right next door to my room. All staff very apologetic but had I been told when booking I would have chosen another hotel this time. Staff still very helpful and polite

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service from the Ladies behind the desk killed it for me.”
Reviews.Author: Kage_MD
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is a gem. It's nice for those who want to avoid the hustle and bustle of Causeway Bay, yet stay in an area close to supermarkets, pharmacies that also happens to be within walking distance to the Happy Valley Racetrack (awesome experience just go!) and very close to major shopping areas. The rooms are indeed small. Given the nature of HK maybe that's just the nature of most hotels, but having stayed at the Lanson Place (hotel in causeway bay) small is fine as long as the facilities are modern and clean. The rooms looked old, the toilet was a whisper flush that I was afraid was going to clog, and the showers are more aptly named drip faucets with a questionable shower curtain probably older than my 8 year old nephew. All the above however, are fine. What was intolerable was the condescending attitude by the front desk personnel who were downright rude to me and my brother over us trying to get access codes for the free internet access at the hotel. Note to people that stay there, you get 1 code per room, even if you are paying for 2 people to be in that room who both have computer and need to get online. OF course explaining this policy (which isn't written anywhere) would have been ideal, but the two ladies probably found it more entertaining to look disgusted, walk away from me while I was speaking mid-sentence, and ignore me. As much as I like the location, I am never going to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: grawu
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel tucked in the heart of Happy Valley in Hong Kong. This hotel maintains the classic British feel at soon as you walk in. The rooms are a decent size with all the basics that one requires (free, good breakfast). Staff were wonderful. This would have been perfect if it hadn't been discovered by the Chinese from Mainland CHina. They have yet to learn some manners and class. That said, I would still return in the future. I booked through Hotel.com and they make my booking plus some minor changes very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Dispointed - Not worth the money that paid for”
Reviews.Author: OLMH
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe that this was the same hotel that 91% of the reviewers recommended on TripAdvisor. On 25th October, my husband and I checked in the small lobby and entered the smallest elevator that we've never seen. The elevator could barely fit only us, 2 big luggage, 2 carry-on baggage and a skinny person inside. The standard room was very small, after laying our luggage, not much room to move around anymore. The drainage of the toilet was very slow. There was no iron nor iron board inside the room, housekeeping said that they would be available only upon request. There was no free bottle of water provided for the room. When I requested more facial tissues, we could only get one box per day. There was no computer inside the room, so no free internet unless you brought your own laptop. The only thing that we're happy about was the hotel services. The guy at front desk helped us to print our boarding passes twice free of charge. They were able to provide the answers for all the questions that we asked. We got taxi easily with the help of the guys working at the front door (I wouldn't called them bellboys since they were wearing black suits without hats). Location was not at the central, but was helpful with the free shuttle van provided by the hotel. However, since the tiny size of the standard room & elevator, slow drainage of toilet, it was not worth to pay Cdn $130 per night without even iron available inside the room and no free bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “Good nice hotel with a great beds.”
Reviews.Author: elyadimple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks for my extended trip to Hong Kong. It is located not too far from Times Square (aboout 20 min walking). The best thing is that hotel offers a free shuttle to most popular tourists locations. Also it has cafe with breakfast, lunch and a restaurant with dinner. Room service is available as well. Very popular karaoke is located on the 3rd floor. Bed linens and pillows were incredible: goose down and sleep was so comfortable. I stayed in two different rooms: 20th and 22nd floors. The one on 22nd floor was pretty close to elevator, so I could hear elevator working all the time. So you might request a room not immediately close to elevator. Breakfast buffet coupons at the cafe were available for for $50HKD (about 6,5USD) with a choice of eggs. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I thought that draining system in the bathroom could work little better, but i figured out how to use it after all. Overall very good experience. Oh yeah, and in my first room power outlet was only available inside of the drawer in the table, so I thought it was a little weird, but at least you will know where to look for it. Free internet is a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, old-fashioned”
Reviews.Author: panruisi
Reviews.Content: Considering how expensive accommodations in Hong Kong tends to be, I think the rates at The Emperor Happy Valley Hotel are a fairly good deal. (It's cheaper if the reservation is made at least 24 hours in advance.) The hotel is located in a residential area, tucked away from the town's bustling center, and is only a short minibus ride away from the subway (I never had to wait long for the minibus). The room and bathroom were elegant, in an old-fashioned sort of way, and perfectly clean. The bed was comfortable and the silence throughout the night was just beautiful. The service was average. All together, I recommend it as a great place to rest after a long, busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for those comfy with Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: jason1616
Reviews.Content: Happy Valley is a good location but not close to local MTR. However, I travel to HK frequently and am quite comfortable with taking the local minibus. The local minibus runs very frequently between Happy Valley and Causeway Bay. This is a short ride from the Causeway Bay MTR station. I was surprised that the hotel served free breakfast. The breakfast was decent but the surrounding area has a few excellent cheap/local haunts which you may also want to try out. While the hotel is a good value. The rooms have digressed over the years. The carpets needed a cleaning and the wifi was subpar. I had to sit by the door in my particular room to get consistent wifi. The rooms are a bit small, but OK for two people. The service is good. I personally like this hotel as it is located in the upscale Happy Valley area. It's a good area that's not right in the thick of the commercial area. That being said, there is no gym or pool. The area has a lot of local restuaurants (most still have english menus) and many good foot massage places. It's close to the racetrack as well. All in all, I would recommend this to anyone travelling to HK who needs a full service hotel but is on a budget. I would recommend it even more if you are familiar to Hong Kong and don't need to be located right next to an MTR or shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan N
Reviews.Content: Just a gentle stroll away from Happy Valley race course is the Emperor Hotel, which I would recommend to anyone. Good value,immaculate and friendly. I have stayed before and liked it and liked it even more this time.

Reviews.Title: “Avg rooms, Bad restaurant service”
Reviews.Author: Radhika7
Reviews.Content: We got the bookings last minute, so there was not much choice. - Place looked ok at first, but then the food, restaurant service, staff, reception staff were cold, rude and also dumb witted about things. - Food at restaurant was the same everyday - with no continental / european / indian touch - Room was neat and clean - They gave chinese paper everyday to our rooms in spite of us asking for english one - We booked a commute to airport, but that was also mixed up - It is located near some superstores, a mcdonalds, etc so u can pick up stuff in case u need Overall, ok, but need to keep the above in mind - Like I said we booked last minute, so it was ok. In case u r booking last minute, you should just ignore the hiccups and enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mushieBC
Reviews.Content: I had used Emperor Hotel a few years and so decided to spend 2 nights there again while in Hong Kong earlier in November. But gosh, I was very terribly disappointed. I requested weeks ago to have a quieter non-smoking room at higher level. Instead, I was given a smoking room on the 7th floor which was also very close to the elevator. The walls were paper thin and I could hear people talk loudly near the elevator at 12:00 am midnight. The room was tiny. It was actually smaller than the room that I had in Tokyo two weeks ago. I thought hotel rooms in Japan are already quite small. The bathroom's wall was dirty and moldy. While I tried to turn off the shower, some rusty metallic parts fell out of the tap! I slept poorly that night because I could hear water coming down intermittently in drain pipes somewhere in the wall. I decided that I was not going to ruin my holiday by losing another night of sleep at this hotel. So, I moved to a much better and newer hotel (Crowne Plaza) at Causeway Bay the following day. I didn't even bother to request for a refund for the unused night at Emperor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ChrisOslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 nights in this hotel. We will recomend this to amyone visiting Hong Kong. The service was excellent with very helpful staff. The rooms were clean and of good size. They have a shuttle bus which takes you to Times Square, however it's not expensive to take a taxi (ca.20 HKD). It has a very good chinese resturant on the 1st floor. It's always crowded with locals (a good sign for good food). We are certain to return to this hotel. Couple from Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “A night in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SueBrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a stopover from NZ to UK. It was a long way from the airport and not ideally situated for a one night stopover. However the rooms were good and clean. A little small and the beds were hard but this is apparently normal in Hong Kong. We took the airport express to Hong Kong Central and then the MTR to Causeway Bay and then a taxis to the hotel. On the return the hotel provides a free shuttle to Hong Kong Central which has a Cathay Pacific check in desk, which was great for getting rid of suitcases to allow for stress free site seeing. Although the hotel was not convenient for us it would be great for going to see the Horse racing as it was walking distance to the race track. The staff were all polite and the Hotel was very nice.

HotelInfo.Name: The Emperor Happy Valley Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.1 Wang Tak Street, Happy Valley, Hong Kong, China
